google_play_reviews.content: i like the app really it helps those who dont want to work with terminals very good app
good app
Not working its not redirecting to repository to authenticate
I'm trying to clone a pivate gh repo but it stays stuck at 35% :-/
Amazing, like mobile GitHub

It's quite strange, to have a Git Client, that does not have an Option to requests all Files access on your Android device, but rather stores Data under AndroidData subfolder.Thus not letting the other aps accessing it. Should I write the file content also within this app? There is a way to select the root folder, but then you can not clone anything
Crashes all the time, specially when making commits
Can't login using ssh

MGit does not notice the new files I create, which means I can't back up most of my work. This makes it a nonstarter for me. As a secondary issue, as I've tried to use it so far, it's been very slow. Adding and committing files takes several seconds in a small repo. I'm used to this being a sub-second operation on a computer, so it's puzzling. But the main issue is that I simply can't commit new files; it doesn't see them.
Can't find SSH keys on internal storage, so can't use it.

Works just like I need it to, allows me to init repos locally as well as clone to target folders without any dependencies on GitHub or the like. It crashes occasionally when I change settings and feels a little old UI wise but I value function over style. 5 stars from me!
It would be a great app if it actually saved the username and password. But it doesn't.

Hey! I tried to clone a private repo. Rechecked the username and password few times it just says password or username error. I was having trouble.No solved it.Great developers. For future users.You can't use github passwords.You should use Personal Access Token (generated from github)
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for trying MGit. It's not possible to provide support here so please open an issue at https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new 
But if you are using GitHub please note they no longer support using passwords for cloning repos.

google_play_reviews.content: Crashes frequently
Only branches i m able to create and push. Content inside the branch is not going to remote. It wil be great if we have the progress bar / logs to check.

Unfortunately it's terribly frustrating to use on latest Android 12. I have the root folder pointing at documents, but any attempts to clone finishes up the clone and it shows up within the regular files explorer, but you can't see the repo in mgit.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback, unfortunately this is a known issue for Android 11+ devices: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/620

google_play_reviews.content: Great app I especially like the swipeable git menu and the only working git app however their are a few improvements that could be made: - automatic light and dark theme depending on device theme - an option to allow github account access like in gitkraken - creating a new repo I get an error that the head is non existent - small nit-pick but the search icon looks outdated compared to the rest of the app - the repo icon is a slightly confusing and I think that a simple hamburger icon would work
Update completely bricked the app. Can't detect file changes, deleting and reimporting repo throws an error. Unfortunate.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: My apologies, because of privacy changes from Android 11, for users such as yourself on Android +11, MGit no longer has permission to access storage locations outside a few prescribed folders. If you move or reclone your repo to eg. /storage/emulated/0/Documents it should work again. Pls see more details at: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/615

google_play_reviews.content: It was wonderful! And suddenly it won't recognize the remote anymore. Not sure what happened.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: My apologies, because of privacy changes from Android 11, for users such as yourself on Android +11, MGit no longer has permission to access storage locations outside a few prescribed folders. If you move or reclone your repo to eg. /storage/emulated/0/Documents it should work again. Pls see more details at: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/615

google_play_reviews.content: Can't push, authorization problem with correct credentials. I just wasted my thime for using this app. Installed.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. If you are trying to push to a Github repo via SSH you may want to update to the latest version & also check the type of SSH key you are using as Github has recently stopped allowing some types. If you still have a problem, pls open an issues at: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new/choose

google_play_reviews.content: Refreshing to see a app, with no paywall limitations or ads
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave the kind review, I'm glad you find MGit useful. Yes I intend for MGit to not only be open source but to always be available without any limitations or use of ads.

google_play_reviews.content: guess my repo got too big, pull no longer does anything... deleting & re-cloning looks like it works for a minute, then just deletes the repo it supposedly just cloned... uninstalling & looking for a reliable client, because there's no issues with git on other platforms ORIGINAL REVIEW (4/5 stars): if you're trying to use SSH, after you add the key, you need to long press on the key, then from the menu add the password... otherwise you'll just get weird errors... app needs to prompt for PW after import

google_play_reviews.content: Perfect to download repos on monile
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave the kind review, I'm glad you find MGit useful.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Its not really possible to provide assistance via Google Play review comments. If you still have a problem, pls open an issue at: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new/choose

google_play_reviews.content: This is a very great app. Gives me all functionality of git without having to worry about a having a computer super. The app is fast and efficient with an interface very easy to understand. I hope it remains good like this overtime. I will also recommend that you add a command line interface option. This will give users the option to choose between the current graphical interface and a command line interface.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave the kind review, I'm glad you find MGit useful.

google_play_reviews.content: The app is great for straightforward editing on the go. The one thing it's lacking is a commandline area where git commands can be executed. Just yesterday I was in need of rolling back the last commit after accidentally commiting it to the master branch instead of a feature branch. While the command to do so is straightforward, it is not possible with the app in its current state. I'll happily change my rating to 5 stars if the ability to execute git commands is implemented.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. That is a good point, a revert last commit command would be very useful. Pls open a new issue with this feature request at https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new/choose so you can be notified of future progress on implementing it in MGit.

google_play_reviews.content: I had previously given this 2 stars as I liked the concept but couldn't use keys with passphrases. Which even at the time was a nogo (2018) for me. Obviously this had been fixed since but lacks a bit of a intuitive interface. Yet, it does work now making this one of the better git clients for Android.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks you for your feedback. MGit does allow importing SSH keys though the UI is not as good as it could be, pls see this faq for more details:https://github.com/maks/MGit/wiki/faq#how-do-i-use-a-ssh-certificate

google_play_reviews.content: Git client substitution. Great for mobile git clone to local device.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave the kind review, I'm glad you find MGit useful.

google_play_reviews.content: One of the best apps that I have ever used. I am, however very disappointed in the UI. Maybe I'll redo the UI in the repository.

google_play_reviews.content: The most beautiful thing I've ever layed eyes on, the thing that pushed me to write this review is, when you want to edit a file, and click the edit button, IT OPENS YOUR IDE! That blew my mind it's seemless, it's elegant, it's exactly what I want.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave the very kind review, I'm glad you find MGit useful and that the edit functionality works the way you would like it to.

google_play_reviews.content: This app is good it is one of the only apps that let you commit and push from your phone. The only thing is that there is no refresh button and if i make a new branch ob my computer i have to delete the repository on my phone and re-add it. Just a minor inconvenience but still one of the bests apps out there
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave the very kind review, I'm glad you find MGit useful. And you dont need to delete the repo on your phone to do that. Just do Fetch from the repo menu in MGit & then checkout the branch in the Choose Branch screen. If you still have any issues pls open a new issue: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new/choose

google_play_reviews.content: The app claimed to need access to all my local files, but I denied it this permission and the app worked fine: I was able to come a remote repo with no issues. However, returning to the app later, it again asked permission to see all my files and claimed it would not work properly without this permission. Also, it supports username/password authentication for SSH URLs, but goes not support using a smart card for authentication. I'm glad it's open source so I might be able to help fix it :)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review, I'm glad you find MGit useful. MGit is an open source project and all code contributions are welcome: https://github.com/maks/MGit

google_play_reviews.content: Doesn't let you paste raw text into files
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. MGit intentionally does not try to provide a full featured editor. You may wish to try using an app such as "ViperEdit" which I have also published which is intended to work well with MGit.

google_play_reviews.content: I needed to clone Git repos locally on my phone, and this did the job -- it doesn't choke with history rewrites like GitJournal, and it lets me use other apps to edit content. All in all a fine git client.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm sorry to hear you are having problems using MGit. Unfortunately due to technical limitations MGit cannot support SDCards properly with newer versions of Android. google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for leaving the review, glad the cloning functionality is working well for you. I'm planning on improving system editor integration instead of the built-in editor and then focusing more on the core git functionality in the future.

google_play_reviews.content: Have mixed opinion on this app - its mostly positive with small frustration on missing some parts of a general git workflow. It works flawlessly for most things and does what it says. But would like a few more git commands/changes - 1. Git status 2. Some way to see detailed Console log while doing git push (instead of current abridged version) 3. Wat to Specify default remote while push (so that user doesn't need to press origin everytime) 4. Git commit interactive 5. Git branch -a/-r
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. MGit is still very much a work in progress, especially the current very basic 'git status' screen. For the other suggestion please do open issues in the Github repo if they are not already covered by existing feature requests there.

google_play_reviews.content: I absolutely had to come review this. It's a freaking lifesaver! I need to do frequent commits this period working on a remote dev project, but I don't have as much access to a pc as I need. Had to do a cloning and some commits today. Worked great. I was able to edit my files in external apps, I could also change to whatever branch I needed to work on. What I'd really like to see is a 'git status' option and better documentation. I have a few more suggestions, and I'll be creating issues for them. Thanks for the app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you very much for taking the time to leave such a positive review. MGit is still very much a work in progress, especially the current very basic 'git status' screen. And please do open issues in the Github repo with any suggestions or issues you may have.

google_play_reviews.content: Works well for my needs.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the kind review, I'm happy to hear that MGit is working well for you.

google_play_reviews.content: Not sure if I should give this 4 or 5 stars. It has worked well for me though so 5 it is. The only thing that it is missing for me is git status. google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. The top level directory to store all local repos can be set in MGits Settings and it *does* have a file browser to allow you to choose which directory you would like to use.

google_play_reviews.content: I tried other similar apps, and may to say that this is the best. Very simple, handy, with all minimum necessary functions. Thanks for developers.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking time to leave a review, I'm happy to hear that MGit is working well for you.

google_play_reviews.content: Works like a charm. The only problem i have is the commit and push process it tales uneccecary time.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback, its nice to hear. There is work planned to improve the UI for common tasks, but if you have any specific ideas or suggestions, please feel free to open a new issue at: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues

google_play_reviews.content: It has been 4 years since I posted the review, I'm surprised to recieve a reply form the developer today lol
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm sorry to hear you are having problems using MGit. If you could file an issue on GitHub with details I will try to assist: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new/choose

google_play_reviews.content: Crashes a lot.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the review. If you are experiencing issues such as the app crashing the best way to get help is to open issue for this in the Github repo providing as much information about it as possible.  (https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/

google_play_reviews.content: Best git solution I've found for Android. I only wish there was a way to set an external editor for files. The internal editor is terrible.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. It is possible to use an external editor using the "sheet of paper" icon instead of the pencil icon when viewing a file, sorry the icons don't make this particularly obvious.

google_play_reviews.content: Bugs, bugs, crashes and more BUGS.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. I'm sorry you are having issues with MGit  If could you please raise an issue witht he specific problems you are having at https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new and I can look into it more.

google_play_reviews.content: A little finicky to configure, but well worth it.  Glad I can pull down my org-ode files and take care of them locally with orgzly.  Good combo.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. Hopefully the discussion on your Github issue has got it working for you now.

google_play_reviews.content: Keys with passphrase are not supported
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for the feedback. 
This has been a long requested feature and is at the top of my todo list for the next release. You can track work on it and its status on Github: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/66

google_play_reviews.content: Doesn't remember the position in a file when I lock and then unlock the screen. Otherwise good app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking time to leave a review, I'm happy to hear that MGit is working well for you.

google_play_reviews.content: Code editor crashes often on saving. Editor buggy in general, cursor jumps, text paste incomplete.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. I'm sorry you are having issues with the text editor, If you could raise an issue at https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new I can look into it more. Pls include details such as your device, the filetypes you are editing, etc.

google_play_reviews.content: Trying to edit file crashes the program, so sadly not usable for my needs. So close though
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for the feedback. If you could raise an issue at https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new I can look into it more. Pls include details such as filetype etc.
In the meantime, if the internal editor is causing issues, you can also use an external app to edit files (the "paper" icon next to the pen icon in the actionbar when viewing a file)

google_play_reviews.content: Only git app I found that actually works for making quick edits
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking time to leave a review, I'm happy to hear that MGit is working well for you.

google_play_reviews.content: Crashes more frequently than sGit on editing files. Off color palette. But now I cant use sGit without getting a message telling me to download the fork. As per your FAQ it looks like the only reason for this change is so you could put your company name next to it. Why not just leave sGit as it was?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. You can still use SGit as the message is designed to only be shown a few times after installing, however as is pointed out it is currently no longer being maintained by its original author (or anyone else) though anyone is free to do so, with MGit being a fork where I am doing further development as per the FAQ.

google_play_reviews.content: U r awesome...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking time to leave a review, I'm happy to hear that MGit is working well for you.

google_play_reviews.content: Works brilliantly for everything I need it for. Love the log, too.
Unspecified exception on checkout. Tried generating RSA key; file browser broken (where is my public key?).
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm sorry to hear you are having problems using MGit. If you could file an issue on GitHub with details I will try to assist: https://github.com/maks/MGit/issues/new/choose

google_play_reviews.content: I suppose it's the same as SGit was, but why move development onto this app instead, and inconvenience everyone who already had it downloaded? Was the name change really that important?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the enquiry, I've now answered this and other FAQs in the projects wiki: https://github.com/maks/MGit/wiki/faq

google_play_reviews.content: Reliable and mature.
